bug.short_desc: Firefox EXTREMELY slow displaying characters entered by keyboard.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X 10_4_11; en-us) AppleWebKit/533.19.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.1.3 Safari/533.19.4 Build Identifier:
Especially on washingtonpost.com and sodahead.com. I'm not particularly fast entering keyboard characters, since I use only two fingers. Yet often I must wait up till several minutes for Firefox to catch up with the characters I entered by keyboard.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.washingtonpost.com 2.sodahead.com 3. Actual Results: Painstakingly SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW. I can literally enter a comment to post, walk away from my computer, get something out of the refrigerator two rooms away from my computer room, then return, and the complete comment is STILL not fully displayed on the screen.
Expected Results: Spitted out the characters as they are being entered, of course. The characters are displaying instantly here. So why not other websites as well?

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

The instructions for "Safe Mode" are too obtuse. Especially a reference to "Option" key, which my keyboard doesn't indicate. If there is an alternate name for the "Option" key, whoever devised the instructions should have had the wisdom to mention it.
